title: Mel B thought ex 'had cut her finger off' following nightmare
text:
Mel has opened up about the abuse she suffered from her ex-husband (Picture: Getty Images)

Mel B thought her ex-husband had ‘cut her finger off’ following a traumatic nightmare as she reveals she is haunted by flashbacks of their relationship.

The Spice Girls singer previously accused her ex-husband Stephen Belafonte of abuse, which he denied, and she spoke about how her mother, Andrea, had to comfort her following the terrifying dream.

‘I came running down the stairs because I thought my ex had cut my finger off,’ she recently told The Sun.

‘I thought it had actually happened because he was threatening to do that. I was convinced my finger was gone and my mum had to reassure me it was still there.

‘I have to remind myself that I’m living in the present and that the flashback is my brain playing tricks on me.’

Mel has been diagnosed with Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD), a condition which can cause victims of traumatic events to experience disturbing flashbacks – and she has revealed that everyday life feels like a ‘battlefield’ for her.

‘Even though you have left your abuser, there is a whole new way of trying to find yourself and trying to deal with your emotions and PTSD or whatever mental illness you have,’ she continued.

‘I still wake up with night sweats. I know he’s not there but I still have flashbacks and that’s ongoing.’

Mel and Stephen were married for a decade between 2007-2017 (Picture: Getty Images)

Since splitting from her ex-husband, Mel has moved back to her hometown of Leeds to live with her mother and two eldest daughters from her previous relationships to dancer Jimmy Gulzar and Eddie Murphy respectively – 20-year-old Phoenix and 12-year-old Angel – and she admits that living with her family has ‘kept her feet on the ground’.

However, Mel does not live with her only daughter to Stephen, eight-year-old Madison, who currently lives with her dad amid an ongoing custody battle.

The 44-year-old explained that she hasn’t seen her daughter ‘in over nine weeks’, and that the US courts do not recognise her situation as she is a UK citizen.

‘I used to sleep with her [Madison] every night and now all I have is a FaceTime court order which my ex changed the number on, so for nine weeks I’ve been calling the wrong number,’ she explained. ‘Every day I wake up with anxiety thinking, “Can I speak to Madison today?”

‘I now have to go through a custody evaluation, which is more time I have to sit in the same room as my ex and breathe same air as him and still leave it to a judge and jury to decide whether my 70% custody can stay in place because I’ve relocated.’

Mel had first met Stephen in February 2007, with the two tying the knot that June.

However, the TV talent judge previously claimed that the film producer abused her on their wedding night, and continued to subject her to both physical and emotional abuse for a decade.

In December 2016, the couple separated, with Mel filing for divorce from Stephen in March 2017. The divorce was finalised that December.

Mel has since become a patron for the charity Women’s Aid, which helps to end domestic violence against women and children.
